oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Show: Conway Twitty - 1987-01 Parts 4-5
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recordings are of the Ralph Emery Show. The show is hosted by Ralph Emery (entertainer), and features Emery in discussion with his guest: Conway Twitty (musician). The show was recorded on January, 1987. The recordings are for parts four and five, of five parts, of Emery's interview of the Conway Twitty.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Conway Twitty; Ralph Emery
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Ralph Emery and Conway Twitty joke about their wives -- (00:30) Emery introduces Twitty to discuss his recordings with Loretta Lynn -- (04:39) Emery inquires about Twitty's vehicle, and both discuss J. Paul Getty -- (08:05) Emery inquires about Twitty's vehicle collection -- (11:15) Emery asks Twitty to reveal his musical plans for 1987 -- (16:17) Emery asks about the success of "Falling For you For Years," and Twitty reveals his release schedule -- (18:09) Emery inquires about any controversial songs Twitty has had and Twitty's approach to women -- (23:34) Emery inquires about what holds men back from treating women right -- (24:50) Emery inquires about the upcoming schedule in Twitty City, and Twitty reflects on his interactions with Twitty City -- (28:21) Twitty recalls a recording of him performing for the Parker Brothers -- (29:40) Emery talks with his engineer
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Twitty, Conway;
